Expectation1: Participate in project planning and provide accurate time estimates
Situation1: The planning session is informal, and the timeline can still shift without major impact
Situation2: They set aside part of their routine to light a lamp and offer prayers at their home altar.
Story: I glanced at the clock on my laptop, feeling the familiar tug of anxiety. The project planning session was running late, and my manager kept circling back to me for more precise time estimates. As an engineer, I knew how important it was to be present, to contribute, and to show my commitment to the team—even if the session was informal and the timeline still flexible. But as the minutes ticked by, my mind drifted to the small altar in my living room. Every evening, I set aside time to light a lamp and offer prayers, a ritual that grounds me and connects me to my faith as a Hindu. My mother’s words echoed in my mind: “No matter how busy you are, never skip your prayers.” Yet here I was, torn between the expectations of my profession and the quiet demands of my spiritual life. My hands hovered over the keyboard, my heart pounding as I weighed the importance of being a reliable engineer against the comfort and duty of my daily ritual.
